data.title: Madonna's Secret Garden: A discussion of her unreleased recordings
data.text:
Recently,there was a thread devoted to Michael Jackson's unreleased recordings.Another discussion focused on unreleased songs by Stevie Wonder.I love discussing outtakes,alternate versions and other stuff that remains in the vaults.So,this week,let's discuss Madonna and her many unreleased songs.Since there are many other knowledgable,well-informed Madonna fans here,I'm sure you guys will correct me when I'm wrong and provide any additional info that you may have.I'll start with a long list of all the songs,then follow up with more details in each subsequent post.Okay,here we go...

Madonna unreleased songs...

(the following songs were recorded in the late 70s-early 80s and are historically important as Madonna's FIRST recordings)

"Tell The Truth To Me"

"I'm A Hothouse Flower"

"Simon Says"

"Oh,Oh The Sky Is Blue"

"Once I Thought It Was Good (Nobody Wants To Be Alone)"

"Well Well"

(the following songs were recorded live with her band Emmy and The Emmys in 1980)

"Best Girl" (1980)

"Hot House Flower" (1980)

"Bells Ringing" (1980)

"Simon Says"(1980)

"Nobody's Fool" (1980)

"No Time For Love"(1980)

"Drowning" (1980)

"(I Like) Love For Tender" (1980)

"Love Express"(1980)

"Drowing (studio version) (1980)

More songs from this era, most recorded with her band The Breakfast Club (basically the same band with a new name) while others were recorded with Otto Von Wernherr (more on him later)...

"Are You Ready For It" (1980)

"Remembering Your Touch" (1980-1982)

"Laugh To Keep from Crying" (1980)

"I Got Trouble (Roll Over It)" (1980)

"Bells Ringing" (studio version) (1980)

"Crimes Of Passion" (1980)

"Little Boy" (1980)

"Shine A Light" (1980)

"Safe Neighborhood" (1980)

"Let The Sun Shine In" (1980)

"Get Up" (1981)

"High Society (Society's Boy) (1981)

"Love On The Run" (1981)

"Take Me (I Want You)(1981)

"Cosmic Climb" (1982)

"Give It To Me" (1982)

"Don't You Know" (1982)

"Ain't No Big Deal"(1982) demo version

"Ain't No Big Deal" (1982) remix version by Jellybean Benitez

"Ain't No Big Deal" (1982) alternate version

"Shake Your Head"(1982)

"We Live In A House" (1982)

"Oh My" (1982)

"Time To Dance" (1982)

"We Are The Gods (1982)

"Wild Dancing" (1982)

"On The Street" (1982)

'Stay" (1982) demo version

"Let's Go Dancing" (1982)

In late 1983,the first Madonna album was released.From this point on,most of the songs we discuss will be outtakes from each subsequent Madonna album,while others will be movie soundtrack songs that were not used...

"Everybody" (1982) demo version

"Sidewalk Talk" (1983) demo version

"Angel" (1984) demo version

"Crazy For You" (1984) demo version

"Desperately Seeking Susan" (1984) unreleased song recorded for the movie of the same name

"Gambler" (1984) demo version

"Like A Virgin" remix (1984)

"Over And Over" demo (1984)

"Shoo Be Doo" demo (1984)

"Unconfirmed title" (1984)

"Warning Signs" (1984) recorded for the 'Vision Quest' soundtrack

"Get Up Stand Tall" (1985) early version of "White Heat"

"Unconfirmed title" (1985) a song written by Madonna for French singer Nathalie

"Each Time You Break My Heart" (1986)

"Jimmy Jimmy" demo (1986)

"True Blue" demo (1986)

"Working My Fingers To The Bone" (1986)

"Can't Stop" demo (1987)

"Causing A Commotion" demo (1987)

"Love Over The Telephone" (1987) Madonna wrote this song for Don Johnson,who was recording his first album

"Spotlight" demo (1987)

"By Alien Means" (1988) written and produced by PRINCE

"Express Yourself" demo (1988)

"First There's A Kiss" (1988)

"Keep It Together" demo (1988)

"Love Attack" (1988)

"Love Song" with Prince (demo) (1988)

"Possessive Love" (1988) offered to Marilynn Martin

"Cherish" remix by Hank Shocklee and Phil Castellano (1989)

"Dog House" (1989) outtake from 'I'm Breathless' project

"Goodbye My Forever Friend" (1989)

"More" demo (1989)

"Pipeline" (1989)

"Sooner Or Later" demo (1989)

"To Love You" (1989)

"Vogue" (1989) demo contains controversial lyrics

"What Can You Lose" demo (1989)

"Dick Tracy" (1989) outtake from 'I'm Breathless' project

"Actions Speak Louder Than Words" (1991) early version of the underrated Erotica track "Words"

"Cheat" (1991) early version of "Bad Girl"

"Get Over" (1991) offered to Nick Scotti

"Shame" (1991)

"Why's It So Hard" (1991) demo version contains rap by Jamaiki

"You Are The One" (1991)

"Deeper And Deeper" demo (1992)

"Erotica" demo (1992) has a darker S&M theme than the released version

"Thief Of Hearts" (1992) there are sevral alternate mixes

"Eating Out" (1992) early version of "Where Life Begins"

"Freak" (1992)

"Goodbye To Innocence" (1992)

"Love Hurts" (1992)

"No Entry" (1992) there is a rumor that Madonna made a video of this song with Patrick Swayze and Michael J.Fox!

"Queens Pearls" (1992)

"Show and Tell" (1992)

"These Boots Are Made For Walking" (1992)

"This Used To Be My Playground" demo (1992)

"Throb" (1992)

"Jitterbug" (1992)

"Just A Dream" (1993)

"Bring It" (1994)

"I Will Always Have You" (1994) early version of "Inside Of Me"

"I'd Ratha Be Yo' Lover" (1994) an alternate version of "I'd Rather Be Your Lover" features a rap by Tupac Shakur

"Id Rather Be Your Lover" demo (1994)

"Honesty" (1994)

"Keep On" (1994) an early version of "Don't Stop"

"Love Won't Wait" (1994)

"Freedom"(1994)

"Something's Coming Over Me" (1994) early version of "Secret"

"Legend" (1994) title unconfirmed

"Never Trust A Stranger" (1995) a duet with Babyface

"I Can't Forget" (1995) collaboration with David Foster

"I Want You" remix (1997) unrleased remix by Junior Vasquez

"Love Won't Wait (remix) (1997)

"Flirtation Dance" (1997)early version of "Skin" with different lyrics

"Revenge" (1997)

"Gone,Gone,Gone" (1997)

"Like A Flower" (1997)

"No Substitute For Love"(1997) early version of "Drowned World/Substitute For Love"

"To Have And Not To Hold" remix by Goldie (1998)

"La Petit" (1999)

"Liquid Love" (1999)

"Intervention" demo (2000)

"Mecahnical" (2000)

"Just Another" (2000)

"One" (2000)

"Eagles Wings" (2000)

"When The Light Fades" (2000)

"Out Of Control" (2000) an early version of "Impressive Instant"?

"Run" (2000) an early version of "Runaway Lover"?

"After The Storm" (2000)

"Perfect" (2000) this song is registered separately from "Nobody's Perfect".As this list clearly demonstrates,Madonna has a habit of re-working songs,so this may or may not be an alternate version.

RUMORED SESSIONS with SASHA (not sure exactly who "Sasha" is,but reportedly Madonna recorded a bunch of songs with him,probably for the 'American Life' album)

"Relief On Demand" (2002)

"Heart Beat" (2002)

"Take Away" (2002)

"All the Way Down" (2002)

"Painted Pictures" (2002)

"Storm" (2002)

The next batch of songs are confirmed outtakes from the 'American Life' CD...

"Mr.Ejector (or "My Ejector") (2002)

"Can't You See My Mind" (2002)

"Adverse Youth" (2002)

"X-Static Process" (2002) a fast,dance version of this song

"Mind Trapper" (2002)

"Bad Nature" (2002)

"Forbidden Fruit" (2002) offered to Jessica Simpson

"Trick" (2002) this is the rumored collaboration with Air

...

[This message was edited Thu Sep 11 6:18:40 PDT 2003 by DavidEye]

AaronSuperior

FlyingCloudPassenger said:

Hmmm, interesting. I never knew she'd have so many unreleased stuff.

One that stands out is "By Alien Means" (1988) written and produced by PRINCE , what's this one like? I never heard about this one.

Must have been done around the time of Love Song, may have that bad ass Camille sound...!

Anyone want to describe it or something?

And funny but a while back, I think before the internet, I heard about Funk Of A THousand Years...and I thought, man, that must be an awesome song! But never heard from that until this thread, weird.

Funk Of A Thousand Years is one of the supposed Madonna/Prince tracks that was going to be in From Dusk Til Dawn. It wasn't. It was confirmed false by PP employees, as a joke that another PP employee had started in Prince circles. I had passed this tidbit on to the madonnacatalog site, and it was included there for years (it may still be) until I corrected it.

By Alien Means is a Prince track from around 1988/1989, and he supposedly gave it to her after seeing her Blond Ambition show in 1990. I believe, at the time, it was either going to be a one-off single (or various artists compiliation track). The rumor of it resurfaced again for the Erotica album.

From what I've gathered, no Prince fan or Madonna fan has ever heard the song, in any form (as either a Prince or Madonna outtake).

AaronMaximus

DavidEye said:

"Laugh To Keep from Crying" (1980)

"Crimes Of Passion" (1980)

"Ain't No Big Deal"(1982) demo version

'Stay" (1982) demo version

released on Pre-Madonna (and In The Beginning)

"Shake Your Head"(1982)

i believe it's actually "Bang Your Head (Let's Go To Bed)" and it was with Ozzy Osbourne. i *believe* this came out as a duet between Ozzy and someone like Lita Ford, but i'm not sure.

"Sidewalk Talk" (1983) demo version

turned up later as a Jellybean track, with Madonna and Catherine Buchanan on vocals

"Desperately Seeking Susan" (1984) unreleased song recorded for the movie of the same name

false. this refers only to Into The Groove. and even incorrectly at that, as she had written the song for another singer (with the title of "Get Into The Groove") before she was going to use it as her own.

"Warning Signs" (1984) recorded for the 'Vision Quest' soundtrack

and another song "Lies In Your Eyes". both have been available on bootlegs, though one of them sounds to have another singer doing lead vocals.

"Spotlight" demo (1987)

actually, this is from 1986. it was a True Blue outtake that got remixed by Jellybean for YCD.

"By Alien Means" (1988) written and produced by PRINCE

Madonna's version is post-1990, though. the story that goes along with it is that he gave it to her after seeing Blond Ambition.

"Love Song" with Prince (demo) (1988)

i imagine that the demo refers to whatever tape Prince gave her to work on initially. they traded it back and forth over the months, until it was complete. there probably isn't an actual "demo" of them doing it together, as they never worked on it in the studio together.

"Possessive Love" (1988) offered to Marilynn Martin

released, i believe.

"Dog House" (1989) outtake from 'I'm Breathless' project

was inspired by Brenda Lee's track from the *other* Dick Tracy soundtrack that was out at the time. "You're In The Dog House" it was called, i think.

"Vogue" (1989) demo contains controversial lyrics

has a "doesn't matter if you're straight or gay" instead of "black or white"

"Dick Tracy" (1989) outtake from 'I'm Breathless' project

don't know about this. she does sing a completely different, Stephen Sondheim version of "Back In Business" in the film, though.

"Get Over" (1991) offered to Nick Scotti

and released by him, also.

"Erotica" demo (1992) has a darker S&M theme than the released version

most likely the one with alternate lyrics that came with the Sex book.

"Goodbye To Innocence" (1992)

released on "Just Say Roe" .. and turned up as a b-side for Secret in Mexico, i think. is the basis for "Up Down Suite"

"Queens Pearls" (1992)

is this the Jose & Luis track? or was that "Queen's English". or something like that. i have a remix of their song that she gave them on some rare Maverick promo sampler, that has background vocals by Madonna.

"These Boots Are Made For Walking" (1992)

don't believe this was ever recorded. it was intended for 1993, and she had a whole campaign planned around it, but Billy Ray Cyrus came out with his version just as she was getting ready to do it. she was extremely pissed and scrapped the whole thing.

"This Used To Be My Playground" demo (1992)

there's also the movie version, approx. 7 minutes long. the instrumental of the movie version showed up on the import CD single, but alas, the beautiful full length vocal version has never been released.

"Jitterbug" (1992)

refers only to her scene dancing the jitterbug in A League Of Their Own

"Just A Dream" (1993)

given to Donna Deloray, I believe. and released. I believe.

""I'd Ratha Be Yo' Lover" (1994) an alternate version of "I'd Rather Be Your Lover" features a rap by Tupac Shakur

some say this is a fake.

"Love Won't Wait" (1994)

given to, and released by, Gary Barlow.

"Freedom"(1994)

on the Carnival! various artists album.

"Something's Coming Over Me" (1994) early version of "Secret"

the original version she wrote with Shep Pettibone, i imagine.

"I Want You" remix (1997) unrleased remix by Junior Vasquez

but very very easy to find, in both full length and edit form on any filesharing service.

"Love Won't Wait (remix) (1997)

i think it's a remix of the Gary Barlow version.

"To Have And Not To Hold" remix by Goldie (1998)

seriously doubt that. he was one of those pricks going around in 1998 telling anybody who'd listen that he'd turned her down to work on the album or remixes.

there is, however a track that she did with... ummm... what was his name. Robert Miles? he did that track "Children" in approx. 1996. Sky Fits Heaven sounds a lot like it.

"Can't You See My Mind" (2002)

this is a completely different song. one in her stable of remix DJ's (i forget who, probably Rauhofer or Calderone) mentioned that he was doing a remix for this song. and that it wasn't Die Another Day

"Forbidden Fruit" (2002) offered to Jessica Simpson

and to be released on her forthcoming album.

also, there's that track she gave to Kylie for a b-side that never did turn up. forget the title though.

[This message was edited Tue Sep 9 23:25:46 PDT 2003 by AaronMaximus]

[This message was edited Tue Sep 9 23:27:33 PDT 2003 by AaronMaximus]
